name: Boca Beach Club, A Waldorf Astoria Resort

reviews.text: I stayed at the Boca Beach Club on Fathers Day and was immediately greeted with a warm smile and beautiful atmosphere. I was blown away by the beauty of this hotel and more importantly the helpful man with glasses at the Front Desk, I believe his name was Mike. He went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and even upgraded us to a nicer room. The breakfast was grade A and the rooms were clean, crisp, and comfortable. I can't wait to come back to the Beach Club!
reviews.title: TOP NOTCH RESORT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This beachfront hotel is great. Rooms are very nicely decorated and clean, restaurants both poolside and in the lobby were delicious, and I appreciated the staff being so grateful when we gave them a tip. 2 drawbacks- it's a bit noisy- you can hear people talking if they are walking past your room and when we had dinner out on the terrace , it was so beautiful and calming hearing the waves crashing on the beach but, the club music that they were playing didn't seem to fit in.
reviews.title: breezy beach destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With that being said, I would most definitely go back again!!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel dates: 10th - 15th June 2012
reviews.title: A wonderful, relaxing vacation

reviews.text: Room Type: Sky Deck
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, one of the nicest places that I have ever stayed. The Boca Resort & Beach Club is quite exclusive. It is a massive property with several buildings, including a beach resort which you can take a shuttle to and it is located on the beach off of Route A1A. The landscaping on the grounds is absolutely beautiful.We stayed for 4 nights in the Bunglows on the property, which was very quiet and serene. We were in a first floor room that had two double beds even though we asked for Queen beds. But the room was very clean and well kept and the furniture was very nice. The bathroom was also very clean and had an exception glass and marble shower. We would have preferred a one or two room suite because those rooms have full kitchens with stainless steel appliances. We asked for an upgrade upon check-in but were not allowed to have one since we were staying as guests of a Hilton hotel employee (Hilton owns the Waldorf properties) and while we were very disappointed about that because there were so many empty rooms during our stay since it was the off season, we got over it. We also requested a refrigerator upon check-in because they say that regular rooms in the bungalows do not have them, when we got to the room we were happy to find out that there already was a refrigerator. But watch out, they will charge you $100 for a refrigerator if they have to bring one for you. The biggest disappointment regarding the property was no ice machine. I realize it's exclusive but a lot of people like to have ice for drinks, etc. If you want ice you have to call room service for them to bring a bucket. We also ordered room services twice and each time they came back within an hour to get the tray. We weren't even done eating. I felt a bit rushed and wasn't happy about that. The pool at the bungalows was fabulous. It was mostly empty except for a few other people here and there. They even had a snack cart driving around the property that would stop by a few times a day. However, two canned sodas cost $9. Ouch. Because the property is so large they have shuttles that take you from one location to another but only to buildings on the property. If you leave the property in your own car, you must return through a gate and show your parking pass. Not a big deal but I thought the security was a bit tight, including a guard with a gun at the back gate closest to the bungalows. He was very nice though. I thoroughly enjoyed the stay at this property though leaving and returning was a bit of a hassle. It made me want to stay within the gates. There were very few people staying in the bungalows and it seemed there was a conference going on at the main building. We also ate in the Cathedral dining room for breakfast. which was excellent though it was $54 for two of us. We then took the shuttle to the Beach Resort which is also quite beautiful. They have three pools right on the beach but definitely more kids were there. We had 3 margaritas and an iced tea for $54. Same as breakfast. Ironically room service was cheaper each time. I would recommend this place for people that like to be waited on hand and foot. There seemed to be a ratio of 3 staff per every person or more. But bring lots of money, it's expensive. it's also for the people that don't care to leave the resort and do all of their shopping, dining, and playing right in the same place. There are several very nice exclusive restaurants in the main building, which is a beautiful place in itself. For me it seemed like I was under lock and key too much. I prefer to come and go as I please. But that doesn't take away from the beauty of this place. It is one of the best. One more thing. parking for the other locations costs per day. However, parking for the bungalows was free.
reviews.title: Exclusive Property - Under Lock and Key

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and neat. The staff was friendly and professional. The ocean is beautiful...
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: However, my first complaint is that our partial ocean view" room was not an accurate description. If you really tried, you could potentially make out a sliver of the ocean. It did, however, have a great view of the intracoastal waterway. My problem is, we booked and paid for something different than we received.
reviews.title: One of the best vacation experiences our family has had to date!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, as earlier reviews lament, you will be nickled and dimed for a lot of items during your stay. Be prepared to spend $15 for a house cocktail (before tip) and about $25 for a bar fare lunch while sitting around the pool.
reviews.title: Boca on the beach

reviews.text: Lastly, although we booked and paid for the "bed and breakfast" package, which included free breakfast, the hotel placed it on our bill after we left and have still yet to refund it. Al in all, you can do much better by staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: I felt as though I was someone very special....superb !

reviews.text: Stayed a couple of nights and liked what I saw. The hotel is very modern, hip cool looking, even though it's very family oriented. The main boca resort is totally different to the beach club. Great beach, lots of people to help you with anything you need. Rooms are awesome, maybe a little too small. Tv could be bigger and nowadays a Waldorf should have hd tv in every channel.
reviews.title: Great location. Great amenities

reviews.text: The spa at the main resort is the best spa I have been to in a while! Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: It does get packed during the weekend so if you are looking for privacy it may not be for you.
reviews.title: Great place but everything's expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have loung music all day from the early morning in the pool area, gives it a south beach feeling but with kids running around, that felt a bit strange, not a complaint just a comment.
reviews.title: Fabulous food and service.

reviews.text: Overall awesome place and would definitely do it again!
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation

reviews.text: I traveled here with my husband for a work event. We were bummed because the main pink resort was sold out, so our second choice was the Boca Beach Club. Wow, this should have been our first choice.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!

reviews.text: Valet-Very friendly people, no issues.
reviews.title: Boca Beach Club Delivers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in-From the moment you walk in the resort, you are amazed at the beauty. The lobby/foyer looks out onto the ocean. Staff was gracious and helpful.
reviews.title: beautiful property amazing service

reviews.text: Rooms-very modern, updated. Flat screen TV's. The one thing I would have liked was a balcony. We had an ocean view room, but you have to pay much more for the balcony. Very nice amenities.
reviews.title: Wonderful & Relaxing Weekend

reviews.text: Pool-There are 3 pools on the resort. One is adults only. The pools are very nice, but when we were there very crowded with kids. An escape to the adults pool solves that problem.
reviews.title: Fun, easy, stylish - what a resort experience should be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach Club at Boca Raton was an awesome establishment. The facilities were top notch from the pristine rooms to the fabulous pools and wonderful ser vice. Our ocean view was both nice on the eyes and calming to the spirit. This would definitely be a place we would visit again.
reviews.title: Weekend with Friends

reviews.text: Me and my friends wanted to have a relaxing and yet elegant vacation. We decided the boca beach club fit well under that category considering it was completely renovated. I booked a regular oceanview room on the 7th floor, gorgeous view. Unfortunetly for me and my friends it was a rainy weekend. No worries we decided to go to the spa and get mani/pedis. We dined at lucca, waiter really nice and informative. Food was excellent, you get what you pay for. We had a minor defect with our tv, the engineering just changed out the tv. The next day we ordered room service for breakfast. The food was up in less than 20minutes and it was hot and juicy. The waiter set everything up on one of the night stand very nicely. I was immediately full. Then went out to the pools for a while everyone as you can expect friendly. Our overall experience was great. Such a great time that as we checked we got a little sad because the vacation was over but dont worry the boca beach club will see us again.
reviews.title: Far from Reality

reviews.text: If you are looking for a great, relaxing, pampering time away from it all, the Beach Club at the Boca Resort is the place to go. You will not find a better place to take a family vacation. We have been going to the Resort for almost 9 years. We don't go anywhere else. We have stayed in all parts of the resort, but our favorite spot is the Beach Club.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Vacation Spot - The Beach Club is the Best

reviews.text: The Beach Club just reopened after an extensive renovation and it is gorgeous. From the minute you arrive in the lobby, you feel as if you have escaped and left all the stress behind. The new infinity pool across from the reception desk, the new lobby bar and restarurant are all spectacular.
reviews.title: Fabulosity!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and the beds are awesome. My wife even took off the sheets to see what kind of matress it was. She travels often for business and she has never had a better nights sleep in a hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend Away!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three days unfortunately. The service was horrible. The housekeeping is very poor. !! The service is very unfriendly, especially at the bar, which is the combination at poor and care less service. I could complain about this place all day long, but I don’t want to waste my time!!! Never again………
reviews.title: House of rude service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great efficient service, good food with several restuarant choices
reviews.title: Contemporary beachfront fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service 24/7
reviews.title: Nice location, average service

reviews.text: Nice pools w/ food and drink service
reviews.title: Equally nice for families & adults

reviews.text: Dont tip the bellman or vallet because a $20 service charge is added daily to your bill that includes that
reviews.title: Absolutely horrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Boca Beach Club the third week of August. This was for our 15th wedding anniversary. It was our first trip without our children. We travel a lot to FL and the Caribbean. The Boca Beach Club far surpassed any other resort we have stayed at in either of these locations.
reviews.title: Wonderful 15th Anniversary getaway!

reviews.text: When we first pulled in, I was a little nervous. The front looks a little utilitarian. Not really what I was expecting for this newly renovated, beach resort. However, once we walked in to the lobby, it blew us away. It was beautifully done. It rivaled any of the places we have stayed at in the Caribbean or even Hawaii. The front desk staff was very nice and welcoming. We were staying there for 4 nights on Hilton Honors points. They still upgraded to ocean view (originally it was booked as Intercoastal waterway view). I thought that was nice, given we weren't paying for the rooms.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience We've Had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got up to the room, it was spotless. Brand new - nicely decorated (though the whole hotel is very contemporary - not my taste but figure, hey, I'm not living here so I can deal with it for a hotel stay). The bathroom was amazing. Really high end fixtures (the shower is incredible). This is the first time i have seen Grohe fixtures in a hotel bathroom!. I don't even have them in my house! We had a king size bed and the room was plenty big for the two of us. It overlooked the adult pool with a very nice view of the beach.
reviews.title: It's a Club not a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach there was very nice. One of the nicest I have been to in FL. I also loved the fact that there were life guards. I always feel a little creeped out when I'm swimming in the ocean and there is no one there just in case. They were attentive too. They definitely had an eye on things. The people working at the tikki hut for chair and umbrella rentals were helpful and friendly. The water was incredible. Bath tub warm and very clear.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Friendly Staff, Wonderful Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't go to the pool too much as we are more beach people, but there were 3 pools. One was just for adults. The other 2 were your typical family resort type pools. All three looked very nice though.
reviews.title: Big rip off!! Beware!!!

reviews.text: This was our first holiday with twin 2 year olds so we were terrified as to how much of a holiday this might actually be. The Boca Beach club was heaven-sent. Beautiful pools, room had a fantastic view and the staff were 1st rate which enabled us to de-stress for a bit as we were very apprehensive about taking lively children to a very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic, discrete + child friendly. Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Child about to launch into a huge tantrum, appearing from no-where is a member of staff with a penny just in time to diffuse the situation - expertly done!
reviews.title: 1st rate hotel

reviews.text: We have been fortunate enough to have stayed in some amazing places and Boca Beach resort rates highly. Restaurants were wonderful, staff highly attentive; I can't think of any downsides at all. It was a great break in a beautiful setting and I may even break our rule of not going to the same place twice as it was truly enjoyable.
reviews.title: Perfection in every possible way

reviews.text: We were in Boca recently for a wedding and stayed at the Beach Club. It is a first rate hotel. Although small the room was beautifully appointed, with a great view and an enormous balcony. Service was tremendous, even compared to other Waldorf properties. I'm shocked by other comments about rude staff. We found the staff to be warm, attentive and welcoming, I particularly appreciated service from the bellman on check-in who reminded me that tips were included in the resort as he wanted to make sure I intended to give an extra tip, Sarah, our waitress for breakfast and dinner, and the Restuarant manager. The overall ambiance reminded me of a high end European resort. We are coming back in the Winter and will try the Resort. Hopefully it will live up to the high standards of the Beach Club.
reviews.title: Horrible, staff was very rude

reviews.text: We are local - loved the hotel from having gotten married there, so we started going back as guests - it grew on us. The incredible pools, great kids environment, and the unreal restaurants (I travel for a living, and this place has some of the best hotel restaurants I have ever seen - on any continent!)....so we paid the hefty price and joined ! Best decision ever - the only tip I would give is to stay away everyone - it might make the place too crowded for the rest of us that already know about it :) One additional tip for out-of-towners - bring the gym clothes - the Beach Club gym is the best hotel gym I have ever seen.
reviews.title: Great beach resort, but billing issue left a negative last impression

aka: Boca Beach Club, a Waldorf Astoria Hotel Boca Raton
description: Immerse yourself in the elegantly restyled The Beach Club - a completely refurbished Boca Raton beach hotel, providing ideal access to the water. Enjoy the stunning views of the rolling waves of the Atlantic Ocean. Stroll along the white-sand shores. Just a short shuttle ride from the renowned Boca Raton Resort & Club, this oceanfront property shares all the luxurious amenities and activities with the Resort, offering endless choices for recreation.
